item.title: Cindy add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "Oh, magic hour, when a child first knows she can read printed words." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "[t]he child must have a valuable thing which is called imagination. The child must have a secret world in which live things that never were. It is necessary that she <i>believe</i>. She must start out by believing things too ugly for living in, the child can reach back and live in her imagination." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Cindy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Cindy add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "When you're in jail, a good friend will be trying to bail you out. A best friend will be in the cell next to you saying, 'Damn, that was fun'." -- Groucho Marx
